intro: Gussonia lagoensis, commonly known as the Lagoensis Tussock, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along streambanks. Gussonia lagoensis plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
